sn14.13:2.2: The identity of this monk is uncertain. Most manuscripts, and the commentary, simply have Kaccāna here, which is probably not “Kaccāna the Great”. Some manuscripts add a personal name, Saddha or Sandha, while the Chinese parallel at SA 457 has 婆迦利, evidently for Vakkali. He may be the Sabhiya Kaccāna who appears in the same location at SN 44.11.
sn14.13:2.4: The problem of false enlightened ones is discussed at DN 29:4.1, DN 33:1.6.5, MN 11:13.6, MN 49:30.9, MN 104:2.5, and SN 55.25:10.4.
sn14.13:3.2: The appearance of “person” here anticipates the analysis of different kinds of person in the following discourses through to SN 14.29.
